Subject: MATLAB - segmentation violation error with equilibrate
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=128870027; y=EJL_CE4Dfj5h1iDo_z7KO2KDnerR04OvW3SjBBT5JoVcjo5rku8i

Hi there,

I'm using Cantera 1.7.0 on a Windows XP (32bit) machine (Pentium=
 D). 
I've compiled the code on this machine using NET2003 and MATLAB 2006b=
.
All of the examples are running fine; so I guess the compiling AND 
the i=
nstallation worked fine.

Within my MATLAB code the "equilibrate" function =
is called several 
times. Also within subfunction like "fsolve" where the s=
olution 
variable is one of the input variables.
If I start MATLAB and run =
the code a few times I always get this 
segmentation violation error somewh=
ere within the ctmethods mex-
function; but not always at the same call of =
equilibrate!! After some 
runs (not always the same number) my code works.
=
I guess that while using the cantera there's "something" loaded into 
memor=
y which remains there; making my code work after several calls.

I've tried=
 to initialize the solution variables with "GRI30" as well 
as with "import=
Phase".
I've tried "cleanup" after each subfunction.
I've tried equilibrate=
(gas,'TP',1) to use the new solver.
I've tried several different code struc=
tures

But basically I always get the same error.

Does anybody know how to=
 load and unload cantera related "stuff" 
within subfunctions of big MATLAB=
 codes in a definte way?

Has anybody got similiar problems and solved it?
=

Could there be a problem with a lot of calls in a row 
of "equilibrate" (t=
housands of calls within optimizer loops)?

Thanks in advance

Tom

p.s.: j=
ust a tip: 
I've recognized a "pointer like" behaviour of solution variable=
s in 
MATLAB.
if you do something like:
g1=3DGRI30;
g2=3Dg1;
set(g1,'T',400=
);
The set command will have effect on BOTH variables g1 and g2!!!!
